description: {"blocks":[{"key":"61dj","text":"This protocol is for staining with AbSeq and multiplexing 16 different samples from distinct individuals into the same 10x run. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.group_name: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhcqh","text":"Make all necessary preparations for the experiment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blo6o","text":"Notify the IHG core that the 10x Controller will be used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t5m4","text":"Book the Attune NXT for cell counting.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pg94","text":"Find the samples the day before (Day 0) and place them in a separate box for easy access the following morning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11s6o","text":"Keep frozen PBMC vials on dry ice and thawed cells on watery ice when not in use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2dhp","text":"Days do not have to be in order. In general, DNA can be kept at 4°C for < 72 hours and -20°C for < 1 week.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"9nnr7","text":" Pool all antibodies being used in this experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A4693D20E20E11E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680026,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Prepare antibody pool"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fs4la","text":"Turn water bath on to 37\u00b0C, aliquot ~40 mL of EasySep buffer into a tube, and place in the water bath until it comes to temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C7E42F80E20E11E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680027,"previous_guid":"A4693D20E20E11E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Thaw Frozen PBMCs"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"490vc","text":"While it warms,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bfm1s","text":" Get 1 bucket with dry ice and 1 large container with regular ice.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ebehg","text":"Get 1 RT Mr. Frosty\/Styrofoam box to re-cryopreserve cells after thawing.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"98ju8","text":"Prepare and label the following: labeled 15-mL Falcon tubes and one U-bottom plate:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8plqg","text":"16 15-mL falcon tube with 5 mL EasySep buffer in each","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"q488","text":"1 U-bottom plate with 16 wells containing 160 uL of flow buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4fvsm","text":"1 FACS tube with 450 uL of flow buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E9A1BA70E20E11E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680029,"previous_guid":"C7E42F80E20E11E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Thaw Frozen PBMCs"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bksnc","text":"Bring all the vials from liquid N2 tank and keep them on dry ice during the preparation time until needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AB770150E20F11E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680030,"previous_guid":"E9A1BA70E20E11E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Thaw Frozen PBMCs"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"de9om","text":"Thaw two vials at a time, unscrew aseptically and mix gently with P1000 (2x up and down should be enough).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B182DB50E20F11E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680031,"previous_guid":"AB770150E20F11E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Thaw Frozen PBMCs"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9h3hf","text":"Withdraw the appropriate volume containing 2 million cells (as calculated in accompanying worksheet) from each sample\u2019s vials and deposit drop-wise into a 15 mL falcon tube with warm EasySep buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2523FDF0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680034,"previous_guid":"B182DB50E20F11E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Thaw Frozen PBMCs"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfoja","text":"Close the top of cryovial tightly and place cryovials with the rest of cells into RT Mr. Frosty. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3169C6D0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680035,"previous_guid":"2523FDF0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Thaw Frozen PBMCs"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vabu","text":"Once all vials have been used or closed, move the Mr. Frosty into the -80\u00b0C freezer. The next day, move the vials to the LN2 storage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"35245DD0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680036,"previous_guid":"3169C6D0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Thaw Frozen PBMCs"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cbalq","text":"Centrifuge the 16 15-mL tubes at 300 g for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3A3E0FA0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680037,"previous_guid":"35245DD0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"DNAse Treatment"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2m59","text":"Pour off supernatant (in one swift motion, being careful not to discard the pellet) and dissociate cell pellet by running the tube on the hood rack. Resuspend the cells in 1 mL of EasySep buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7C4CEB50E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680038,"previous_guid":"3A3E0FA0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"DNAse Treatment"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5gb1l","text":"Add 1 \u00b5l of DNaseI per sample, and mix by swirling. Incubate for 15 min at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"8726EF30E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680039,"previous_guid":"7C4CEB50E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"DNAse Treatment"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89v8q","text":"1.1.1. During incubation, prepare 16 15-mL tubes with 40 um filters on top.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"8EE6BAC0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680040,"previous_guid":"8726EF30E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"DNAse Treatment"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14hcm","text":"1.1.1. Using a P1000, transfer the DNaseI-treated sample onto the 40 um filter and filter through. Wash each tube and filter with an additional 4 mL of EasySep, 1 mL at a time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9A114FA0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680041,"previous_guid":"8EE6BAC0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"DNAse Treatment"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21l69","text":"Centrifuge the 16 15-mL tubes at 300 g for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A8D84520E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680042,"previous_guid":"9A114FA0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer"}
steps.section: Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"a4n5n","text":"1.1.1. Pour off supernatant (in one swift motion, being careful not to discard the pellet) and dissociate cell pellet by running the tube on the hood rack. Resuspend the cells in 200 uL of EasySep buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B9C500D0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680043,"previous_guid":"A8D84520E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer"}
steps.section: Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"9hedi","text":"Take 10 uL from a random set of 5 samples and add to the FACS tube with flow buffer to use as a control sample for setting voltages on the Attune.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C97DF770E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680044,"previous_guid":"B9C500D0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer"}
steps.section: Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"evfbc","text":"Take 40 uL from every sample and place into the corresponding well of the plate that was prepared with flow buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D0F7E060E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680045,"previous_guid":"C97DF770E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer"}
steps.section: Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"btnrj","text":"Bring the plate and tube to the Attune. Load the tube cells, adjust voltages and draw gates to count the number of cells within the total and live gates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D8CC9380E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680046,"previous_guid":"D0F7E060E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer"}
steps.section: Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"6rr68","text":"Load the plate and record the samples in the plate, using a 100 uL recording volume, 100 uL per minute flow rate. Record the values of live and total cells in the accompanying workbook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"EA4F2690E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680047,"previous_guid":"D8CC9380E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer"}
steps.section: Counting on the Attune Flow Cytometer

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"3c03c","text":"Withdraw the appropriate volume from each sample based on the cell count to achieve a total of 1 million cells. Pool these into one 15-mL tube, and centrifuge at 300 g for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F16CBEB0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680048,"previous_guid":"EA4F2690E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Pooling and Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ceimg","text":"Pour off supernatant (in one swift motion, being careful not to discard the pellet) and dissociate cell pellet by running the tube on the hood rack. Resuspend the cells in 100 uL of staining buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2CA396C0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680049,"previous_guid":"F16CBEB0E21011E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Pooling and Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brepn","text":"Add 10\u00b5L of FcX blocking reagent, incubate for 10 minutes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":28,"style":"bold"},{"offset":47,"length":18,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"35B2C5B0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680050,"previous_guid":"2CA396C0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Pooling and Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h92j","text":"Add antibody pool to cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"5B3288C0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680051,"previous_guid":"35B2C5B0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Pooling and Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7rk4","text":"Incubate for 30 minutes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":13,"length":18,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6A120F50E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680052,"previous_guid":"5B3288C0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Pooling and Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lqo4","text":"Add 500\u00b5L of staining buffer, centrifuge at 300 g for 5 min. Carefully remove supernatant, don\u2019t disturb cell pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7266C7E0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680053,"previous_guid":"6A120F50E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Pooling and Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnl0h","text":"Wash with 1mL staining buffer for twice, centrifuge at 300 g for 5 min, remove supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":14,"length":16,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9283E940E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680054,"previous_guid":"7266C7E0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Pooling and Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ifbq","text":"Wash with 1mL staining buffer for twice, centrifuge at 300 g for 5 min, remove supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":14,"length":16,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A406F180E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680055,"previous_guid":"9283E940E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Preparing Single Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abqum","text":"Resuspend pellet in small volume (ie. 100\u00b5L of washing buffer), put cell suspension through 40\u00b5m cell strainer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6tss2","text":"If use Flowmi strainer, be careful not to push the pipet tip too hard, that breaks the strainer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8o33j","text":"The volume of cell suspension is lost by ~30% with flowmi strianer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D89D50B0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680056,"previous_guid":"A406F180E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Preparing Single Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0n6f","text":"Take 10\u00b5L of filtered cell suspension for counting with Countess in wet lab or ViCell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a6baj","text":"The desired cell density is 2.5 x 10^6 cell\/mL (or 2500 cell\/\u00b5L).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9lhc","text":"If cells are too dense, use washing buffer to dilute cells to final density of 2500 cell\/\u00b5L.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8bbtn","text":"Use 20\u00b5L for each well of 10x library preparation to ensure 10k cells from each sample are loaded.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"1A9CC310E21211E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680057,"previous_guid":"D89D50B0E21111E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Preparing Single Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b1sr6","text":"Dilute the cells to 2.5 x 10^6 cells\/mL with washing buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"87knf","text":"For 2.5 x 10^6 cells\/mL, ask the core to load 20 \u00b5L for each well.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6t0dm","text":"Make at least 5\u00b5L extra volume for the core to do cell count.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3252DC60E21211E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680058,"previous_guid":"1A9CC310E21211E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Preparing Single Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"763f4","text":"Bring cells to IHG core for 10x library preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ea6vd","text":"Make sure cells are on ice.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9rpga","text":"Follow 10X Genomics 3' v2 user guide for running the controller and library preparation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4D5588A0E21211E8A3E21326802C873A","id":680059,"previous_guid":"3252DC60E21211E8A3E21326802C873A","section":"Preparing Single Cell Suspension"}
